text: so initially I was going to come up here
and talk to you about Spotify is
infrastructure transition to kubernetes
into cloud native apps and then I
realized that I was going to say about
80% of the same thing Sara did and used
the exact same architecture slides so
instead I want to talk about a different
transition that we're trying to lead at
Spotify and that's transitioning to
being a really strong active member of
this community and to try to push all
the rest of you guys to do the same
thing so I think we all agree that free
and open-source software is a really
amazing thing but at least in my opinion
most of us are pretty bad at it and I
say that because I think the greatest
thing about free and open-source
software isn't necessarily contributing
upstream and the code itself or
necessarily even adopting all the
technology it's really engaging with
this community and I don't think Spotify
is necessarily any better and it's
probably worse than many of the
companies here but we're trying really
hard to get better and to actively
commit to getting better so first a
little bit about Spotify we don't really
do open software we're not red hat or a
core OS type company whose kind of core
business is in open source software we
do highly personalized streaming music
we have very autonomous teams hundreds
of them across the company thousands of
services and thousands of engineers and
hundreds of people in a technology
platform team that is supposed to
support all of that and create the tools
and systems and structures that everyone
in the company uses so we have very
loved rough alignment across the org but
no real authority there's on someone
that can just kind of put their foot
down and say you must all go I don't
know blog or tweet or go to conferences
it's really up to every one of those

and how active they are about it but my

at Spotify in those couple hundred

how do we get started

anyone want to listen to the way I built

but we didn't know who to ask we didn't

course the same thing for everybody's
other thing is whether it's gr PC or sto

our existing on-prem infrastucture
providers all of that but they're still

sharing our story just started to build

there were really a couple of things

of getting support getting guidance and
really just figuring out what's out
there
and I have some kind of some stories
that really convinced me on how great
this is
the first thing for me in this community
was starting to play with with

running in two different namespaces and
most ingress controllers can't do this

and of course we did the normal

what the problem was was someone for
maps code and they just walked us

this was amazing
so then I really kind of I really wanted

I was really hooked at that point I said

like on my very first call with the end

we have to emphasize that we're all just

the CNC F is the first foundation we've
